reviews.text: The last stop from Glasgow and Edinburgh and the main station in Helensburgh just around the corner from the clide cost and the town centre station staff are very helpful and professional and a lovely place to visit or to have a holiday

Apart from trains being most of the time late or cancelled , the station is well maintained  clean and tidy,  seats are available around and pretty much sheltered from rain or snow, disabled toilets are also available on site.
Staff members are helpful.

Today I had a real senior moment and left my tablet on a bench on the platform. I realised as soon as the train had left the station. The ticket collector, Gary, very kindly rang the station who confirmed that it had been found by a member of staff, sorry I don't have the name. Thank you so much.  Arrangements were made for me to collect it later in the day from the ticket office. Thanks to all platform, ticket office and train staff for your help and kindness I really appreciate it.
Dianne Robinson.

Really nice well maintained station in a good location by the seaside. There is a cafe open every day, bike storage, a warm waiting room and toilet facilities as well as full disabled access.

It's just a shame about the dire train company who operate it, despite a decent schedule you are far from guaranteed a train from Helensburgh Central at the best of times as it will either be cancelled, delayed, revised, or start from Hydland instead.

To sum up, yes this station has everything you might need in a station apart from TRAINS. CHECK BEFORE YOU TRAVEL, and then even when you do check, check again.
Very rude and aggressive staff on platform. Failure to give appropriate and respectful safety information.
